title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Budget supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. During control years, the Mayor submits the budget to the President for transmission to Congress. No funds can be spent by District of Columbia government officials unless authorized by the budget. The District of Columbia government officials are prohibited from obligating or expending funds unless approved by the Council or Congress. Reprogramming of budget amounts requires approval from the Mayor and Council after the annual budget adoption. After the annual budget adoption, reprogramming of budget amounts in the District of Columbia requires approval from the Mayor and Council, with any additional expenditures needing offsetting reductions in another activity. The term 'control year' is defined in accordance with the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Congressional review periods for budget acts are also specified in the legislation. In the context of budget reprogramming in the District of Columbia, the legislation specifies a 30-day period for congressional review of Acts transmitted under certain conditions. If no joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted within this period, the Act takes effect after the 30-day period, or on the date prescribed by the Act, whichever is later. If the 30-day period ends when neither House is in session, an additional 5 days are granted for review. An additional 5 days are granted for review if the 30-day period ends when neither House is in session. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act. Several sections of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 and the National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997 are amended to replace references to specific sentences in section 446 with a reference to section 446(c). SEC. 446 Enactment of local budget. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission to the President. Additionally, a new term 'control year' is defined in the subsection. Permitting employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council is also addressed. SEC. 4 amends Section 447 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other conforming amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. SEC. 5 makes amendments to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the federal authority over the budget-making process during control years. It restricts the approval of budgets that are not consistent with the financial plan established under the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 6 states that any general provision in an appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7 specifies that the amendments apply to the District of Columbia budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
